summary: This document is a compilation of news clips from February 22, 2019, covering various SDNY cases and matters of interest. It includes articles on public corruption (John Ulrich), the Mueller investigation, Paul Manafort, the Trump inauguration committee, R. Kelly, general crimes (Therese Okoumou), civil division (NYCHA monitor), civil frauds (FEMA), and a significant ruling regarding the DOJ's failure to confer with victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The compilation highlights multiple ongoing federal investigations and legal proceedings.

persons.name: John Ulrich
persons.context: Former vice president of International Brotherhood of Teamsters Local 812 charged with taking bribes from a health plan administrator. Pleaded not guilty and released on bond.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York quoted in multiple articles regarding the Ulrich case, FEMA fraud, and praised for institutional integrity in an opinion piece.

persons.name: Paul Manafort
persons.context: Former campaign chairman for Donald Trump, convicted on federal financial crimes. Articles discuss potential state charges from Manhattan DA Cyrus Vance Jr. to circumvent a possible presidential pardon.

persons.name: Cyrus Vance Jr.
persons.context: Manhattan DA preparing state criminal charges against Paul Manafort related to bank loans.

persons.name: Robert Mueller
persons.context: Special Counsel investigating Russian interference in the 2016 election. Multiple articles discuss the impending conclusion of his investigation and the expected report.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: President discussed in context of potential pardons for Paul Manafort, multiple ongoing investigations (Mueller, SDNY, inauguration), and alleged attempts to obstruct justice.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: New Attorney General preparing to receive Mueller's report and decide how much to make public. Discussed in context of his past memo on obstruction and the pressure he faces.

persons.name: Michael Cohen
persons.context: Trump's former lawyer, pleaded guilty to campaign finance violations related to hush money payments. SDNY investigation into him and Trump's business is mentioned as continuing.

persons.name: Richard Gates
persons.role: Former Trump Inaugural Committee Deputy Chairman
persons.context: Former deputy chairman of Trump's inaugural committee, cooperating with Justice Department investigations after pleading guilty in a Mueller case. Mentioned in context of inaugural spending scrutiny.

persons.name: Tom Barrack
persons.context: Chairman of Trump's inaugural committee. Mentioned in context of spending concerns raised by Stephanie Winston Wolkoff, but no sign he is under investigation.

persons.name: Stephanie Winston Wolkoff
persons.context: Ran WIS Media Partners, a vendor for the Trump inauguration. Her recorded concerns about spending helped prompt the investigation.

persons.name: R. Kelly
persons.context: R&B singer charged in Chicago with 10 counts of aggravated criminal sexual abuse. New accusers Latresa Scaff and Rochelle Washington came forward with allegations of abuse when they were minors.

persons.name: Latresa Scaff
persons.context: Accused R. Kelly of sexual abuse when she was 16 years old after a concert in the mid-1990s. Spoke at a press conference with attorney Gloria Allred.

persons.name: Rochelle Washington
persons.context: Accused R. Kelly of sexual misconduct when she was 15 years old after a concert in the mid-1990s. Spoke at a press conference with attorney Gloria Allred.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney representing multiple accusers of R. Kelly, including Latresa Scaff and Rochelle Washington. Organized press conferences and stated she had confidence in the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Eastern District of New York.

persons.name: Therese Patricia Okoumou
persons.context: Woman convicted of climbing the Statue of Liberty in July 2018 to protest immigration policies. Arrested again in February 2019 for scaling a building in Texas in a similar protest.

persons.name: Bart Schwartz
persons.context: Former SDNY prosecutor appointed as federal monitor to oversee the NYCHA settlement agreement regarding housing conditions.

persons.name: Alexander Acosta
persons.context: As former U.S. Attorney in Florida, he brokered the 2008 non-prosecution agreement with Jeffrey Epstein. A judge ruled the DOJ under him violated the law by not conferring with victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Palm Beach billionaire and alleged serial sex abuser of underage girls. A judge ruled the DOJ violated the law by failing to confer with his victims about the 2008 plea deal.

persons.name: Robert Khuzami
persons.context: Deputy U.S. Attorney for the SDNY, highlighted in an opinion piece for his professionalism and role in high-profile investigations, including those related to Trump.

persons.name: Matthew Whitaker
persons.context: Former Acting Attorney General. Reportedly asked by President Trump to get Geoffrey Berman to un-recuse from the Michael Cohen investigation, which an article argues was an attempt to obstruct justice.

persons.name: Bill de Blasio
persons.context: Mayor of NYC; his administration agreed to pay over $5 million to settle claims it defrauded FEMA with false Superstorm Sandy damage claims.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is prosecuting Ulrich for bribery charges related to his union role.
Vance's office is preparing state criminal charges against Manafort to potentially ensure prison time even if Trump pardons his federal crimes.
Manafort was Trump's former campaign chairman. Trump has defended him and is speculated to potentially pardon him.
Mueller is investigating Russian interference in the 2016 election and any links to the Trump campaign.
Cohen was Trump's personal lawyer. He pleaded guilty to campaign finance violations and implicated Trump in the hush money scheme.
Gates was deputy chairman and Barrack was chairman of Trump's inaugural committee, which is under investigation for its spending.
Scaff accuses Kelly of sexually abusing her when she was a minor after a concert in the mid-1990s.
Washington accuses Kelly of sexual misconduct when she was a minor after a concert in the mid-1990s.
Allred is the attorney representing multiple accusers of R. Kelly, including Scaff and Washington.
Barr is Trump's appointed Attorney General who will be responsible for handling the release of Mueller's report.
Whitaker was Trump's Acting Attorney General. Trump reportedly asked him to get Geoffrey Berman to un-recuse from the Cohen investigation.
As U.S. Attorney, Acosta brokered the controversial 2008 non-prosecution agreement with Epstein.
Khuzami is Berman's deputy at the SDNY, part of the team conducting investigations into matters related to Trump.

events.title: Ulrich Arraignment
events.description: John Ulrich, former Teamsters vice president, pleaded not guilty in New York federal court to charges of soliciting bribes from a health plan administrator.

events.title: Manafort State Charges Preparation
events.description: Reports indicate the Manhattan District Attorney's office is preparing state criminal charges against Paul Manafort to ensure prison time even if he receives a presidential pardon.

events.title: R. Kelly Charged in Chicago
events.description: R. Kelly was charged in Chicago with 10 counts of aggravated criminal sexual abuse, following renewed scrutiny from a documentary and new evidence.

events.title: New R. Kelly Accusers Press Conference
events.description: Latresa Scaff and Rochelle Washington, represented by Gloria Allred, held a press conference in New York to accuse R. Kelly of sexual abuse when they were minors in the mid-1990s.

events.title: Judge Rules DOJ Violated Law in Epstein Case
events.description: A federal judge in Florida ruled the Department of Justice violated the law by failing to confer with victims of Jeffrey Epstein about his 2008 plea deal.

events.title: NYC Settles FEMA Fraud Lawsuit
events.description: New York City agreed to reimburse the federal government over $5.3 million for falsely claiming FEMA reimbursement for vehicles damaged before Superstorm Sandy.

events.title: Bart Schwartz Appointed NYCHA Monitor
events.description: Former SDNY prosecutor Bart Schwartz was appointed as the federal monitor to oversee the NYCHA settlement agreement regarding housing conditions.

events.title: Mueller Report Expected Soon
events.description: Articles report that Special Counsel Robert Mueller is expected to deliver his report to Attorney General William Barr within weeks, concluding the investigation into Russian interference.

events.title: Okoumou Arrested in Texas Protest
events.description: Therese Patricia Okoumou, previously convicted for climbing the Statue of Liberty, was arrested after scaling a building in Austin, Texas, to protest immigration policies.

keyFacts: A federal judge ruled the DOJ violated the law by failing to confer with victims of Jeffrey Epstein about his 2008 non-prosecution agreement, which gave him a light sentence.
The Manhattan District Attorney's office is preparing state criminal charges against Paul Manafort to potentially circumvent a presidential pardon from Donald Trump.

R. Kelly was charged with 10 counts of aggravated criminal sexual abuse in Chicago, and two new accusers, Latresa Scaff and Rochelle Washington, came forward with allegations of abuse when they were minors.

Special Counsel Robert Mueller's report on Russian interference in the 2016 election is expected to be delivered to Attorney General William Barr within weeks, with significant political and legal implications.
New York City agreed to pay over $5.3 million to settle claims it defrauded FEMA by submitting false damage claims for vehicles not actually damaged by Superstorm Sandy.
